title: Designer spots in…Acapulco?
content:
I’m heading down to Acapulco for a week in January. Most of it will be spent next to the pool working on my thesis letterforms, but are there some cool art/design/type things I should take a look at while I’m there?

 [‹ London 2012 Olympic Logo](http://web.archive.org/web/20080821150521/http:/www.typophile.com/node/34223 "Go to previous forum topic") [Type on Jeopardy! ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080821150521/http:/www.typophile.com/node/38922 "Go to next forum topic")
author: James Puckett

comments.content: James, though my homecity is not Acapulco, I would advice just to avoid using public transport that much and just take some strolls on the city (away from the hotel zones and more into the “real” city) armed with a camera and a sketchbook. We in México don’t really have that much of cultural centres devoted to typography, but the lettering is just out there, in the wild. I am sure you will find something if you keep your eyes wide open.
